title: Collision Detection and Alerts
content:
Collision detection prevents team members from working on the same email simultaneously, avoiding duplicate or conflicting responses.

How It Works:

1. Real-Time Awareness:
   - When someone opens an email, others see a notification
   - Shows who is currently viewing or composing
   - Updates in real-time as people join or leave

2. Visual Indicators:
   - Avatar/profile picture appears on the email
   - Banner notification at the top of the email
   - Color-coded alerts for different team members

3. Conflict Prevention:
   - Warning before sending if someone else is composing
   - Option to coordinate before both send
   - Draft visibility to avoid duplicate work

Collision Scenarios:

1. Viewing Collision:
   - Multiple people reading the same email
   - Low riskâ€”just awareness
   - No action required

2. Composing Collision:
   - Two people drafting responses simultaneously
   - High risk of duplicate responses
   - System alerts both parties

3. Assignment Collision:
   - Email reassigned while someone is working on it
   - Notification sent to both old and new assignee
   - Prevents lost work

Best Practices:

1. Communication:
   - Use internal notes to coordinate
   - @mention colleagues if you need their input
   - Check collision alerts before composing

2. Workflow:
   - Assign emails before working on them
   - Use status updates to show progress
   - Close emails promptly when resolved

3. Team Protocols:
   - Establish rules for handling collisions
   - Define who takes priority in conflicts
   - Use tags to indicate work-in-progress

Configuration:
- Collision detection is enabled by default
- Admins can adjust sensitivity in Settings
- Notification preferences customizable per user

Troubleshooting:
- Alerts not appearing: Check browser permissions
- Delayed notifications: Refresh browser
- False positives: May occur with slow connections

Advanced Features:
- Draft sharing for collaborative responses
- Collision history and logs
- Integration with assignment workflows
